summary: This is an email chain forwarding a timeline of events leading up to and including the death of Jeffrey Epstein in the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 10, 2019. It details his placement on and removal from suicide watch, his cellmate status, and the circumstances of his death, including the discovery of a makeshift noose.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found unresponsive and later pronounced dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Reyes
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate in the Special Housing Unit from July 29, 2019, until his release to the community on August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Unit Manager
persons.context: Reported giving Epstein a telephone call on the evening of August 9, 2019, and described him as being in good spirits.

connections.description: Were cellmates in the Special Housing Unit from July 29 to August 9, 2019.

events.title: Epstein Found in Fetal Position
events.description: Epstein was found in a fetal position in his cell, breathing but unresponsive initially. His neck was red. He was placed on suicide watch and received a medical evaluation.

events.title: Epstein Removed from Suicide Watch
events.description: The Psychology Services Department removed Epstein from suicide watch after daily interactions. He was returned to the Special Housing Unit with a cellmate.

events.title: Cellmate Released, Epstein Alone
events.description: Cellmate Reyes was released from court to the community and did not return. Epstein was in a legal visit all day and was returned to his cell with no cellmate, contrary to protocol as he was on a PSYCH Alert requiring one.

events.title: Epstein Found Dead
events.description: Staff found Epstein unresponsive in his cell during breakfast service. CPR was initiated. He was pronounced dead at the hospital at 7:36 a.m. Bruising was reported around his neck and a makeshift noose was found in the cell.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell on the morning of August 10, 2019, with bruising around his neck and a makeshift noose present.
Epstein had been on suicide watch from July 23 but was removed on July 29, 2019, and placed with a cellmate.
On the night before his death, Epstein was left without a cellmate despite being on a PSYCH Alert that required one, after his cellmate was released.
Two officers reportedly failed to conduct official counts at 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. on the night of Epstein's death and were seen by the Employee Assistance Program (EAP).
